src: بدات تايوان في القرن الخامستعشر فاش بداو لبحارة الأوروبين كيدوزو حدا جزيرة كتسما فورموزا، وهي جزيرة زوينة. في عام 1624، دارت شركة الهند الشرقية الهولندية واحد القاعدة في جنوب غرب تايوان وبدات كتغيير ممارسات إنتاج الحبوب الأصلية وتوظيف العمال الصينيين للخدمة في لفيرمات نتاع الروز والسكر. عام 1683، هيمنات جيوش أسرة تشينغ (1644-1912) على المناطق الساحلية الغربية والشمالية في تايوان وعلنات على أن تايوان مقاطعة تابعة لإمبراطورية تشينغ سنة 1885. في عام 1895 ومورا لهزيمة ديالها في الحرب الصينية اليابانية الأولى ما بين 1894 و 1895 وقعات حكومة تشينغ معاهدة شيمونوسكي، واللي تنازلت فيها على السيادة ديالها على التايوان لصالح اليابان اللي حكمت الجزيرة حتى عام 1945.
mt: Taiwan began in the 17th century when European sailors first arrived at the island of Formosa, a beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan and began changing the island's original grain production practices and employing Chinese workers to serve in the company's rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, the Qing army (1644-1912) dominated the western and northern coastal areas of Taiwan and declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after its defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War between 1894 and 1895, the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded its sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: بدات تايوان في القرن الخامستعشر فاش بداو لبحارة الأوروبين كيدوزو حدا جزيرة كتسما فورموزا، وهي جزيرة زوينة. في عام 1624، دارت شركة الهند الشرقية الهولندية واحد القاعدة في جنوب غرب تايوان وبدات كتغيير ممارسات إنتاج الحبوب الأصلية وتوظيف العمال الصينيين للخدمة في لفيرمات نتاع الروز والسكر. عام 1683، هيمنات جيوش أسرة تشينغ (1644-1912) على المناطق الساحلية الغربية والشمالية في تايوان وعلنات على أن تايوان مقاطعة تابعة لإمبراطورية تشينغ سنة 1885. في عام 1895 ومورا لهزيمة ديالها في الحرب الصينية اليابانية الأولى ما بين 1894 و 1895 وقعات حكومة تشينغ معاهدة شيمونوسكي، واللي تنازلت فيها على السيادة ديالها على التايوان لصالح اليابان اللي حكمت الجزيرة حتى عام 1945.

ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: هادا كيتسمى الرقم الهيدروجيني للمادة الكيميائية.يمكن ليك دِّير مؤشر باستخدام عصير ليشو الموف. عصير الخس كيبدل اللون ديالو علي حسب نسبة الحامضية او القاعدية للمركب الكميائي. مستوى لحموضة تيتعرف بنسبة أيونات لهيدروجين (اللي هو H ف pH) فلمادة ليتدارلها فحص كيميائي. أيونات الهيدروجين هي بروتونات محيدينليها الإلكترونات (حيث أن ذرات الهيدروجين كتتكون من بروتون واحد وإلكترون واحد).
mt: This is called the pH of the chemical. You can use a litmus test to determine the acidity or basicity of the chemical. The level of acidity is determined by the concentration of hydrogen ions (H in pH) in the material, which is measured by a chemical test. Hydrogen ions are protons with an electron (where hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: الأسود هي أكثر القطط اجتماعية لاحقاش تيعيشو فمجموعات تيتسماو الزمرة. الزمرة دالأسد كتكون من ثلاثة د الدكورة عندهم رابط العائلة وتقريبا شي تلاتين نتوة وشبل. النتوات ديما تيكونو قراب من بعضهم، وتيكونو عائلة كبيرة من لخواتات ولبنات. كتصرف زمر الأسود بحال قطعان الذئاب والكلاب حيوانات كتشبه للأسود (ولكن ماشي بحال القطط الكبيرة الأخرى) فالسلوك وشديدة الافتراس للفرائس ديالها.
mt: 1. The black cat is the most social of all cats, living in groups called prides. A pride of lions is usually made up of three to four generations of related females and about thirty cubs. The females are always close to each other, and the family is a large one with many mothers and daughters. A pride of lions behaves like a pack of wolves and wild dogs (but not like other large cats) in its hunting of prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: لّي تحتْ مَنها (صْغر مَنها) هوما القطوط لي مْتوسطة فالحجم و لّي كتّاكـل فريسة متوسطة فالحجم بحال الأرانب الظباء والغزال. وأخيراً، كاين عدد من لقطوط الصغار (بما فيهم القطط الأليفة السائبة) كتاكل الفرائس الصغيرة الأكثر عدداً كالحشرات والقوارض والسحالي والطيور. لمكانة هي الصفة اللي كتعطيهم سر النجاح، وهي فاش لقطة تتكون فواحد بعيدة على التنافس مع لوخرين.
mt: Small cats are medium-sized predators of medium-sized prey such as rabbits, hares, and deer. Finally, there are a number of small cats (including domesticated cats) that prey on small prey in greater numbers, such as insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. Their success is given by the fact that a cat forms a group far away from the competition with the others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: حيوان الأصلوت تياكل الحيوانات الصغيرة. تيشد لقرودة ولحنوشة والقوارض والطيور إلى لقا كيفاش. الحيوانات اللي تيصيدها حيوان الأصلوت تقريبا كلها أصغر منو. تيعتاقدو العلماء أن حيوان الأصلوت كيتبع ويلقا الحيوانات اللي غياكل (الفريسة) بالريحة وكيشم فين كانو فالأرض. يمكن ليهم يشوفو مزيان فالضلام بالرؤية الليلية ،و كذلك التحراك بالتخبية مزيان. النمور القزم كتصيد الفرائس ديالها ملي كتخالط معاها عاد كتنقض على الفريستها.

ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: النمر على اعتبار أنه رياضي شامل كيقدر يتسلق (واخا ماشي مزيان كاع) ويعوم وينقز لمسافات كبيرة ويجر بقوة خمسة أضعاف قوة الإنسان. النمر فنفس المجموعة ديال (Genus Panthera) فحال الأسود والنمور و النمر الأمريكي الجاغوار. هاد القطط الأربعة هي الوحيدة اللي يمكن ليها الزئير. زئير النمر ماشي فحال زئير الأسد بصوت مكمول ولكن فحال شي شوية د الكلمات (جملة ما كاملاش ) فيها عواء ( فحال القطة) لكنُّو مزمجر.
mt: The tiger is a generalist predator, capable of eating (and climbing) large prey, and can carry five times the weight of a human. The tiger is in the same genus (Panthera) as the lion, jaguar, and the American cougar. These four cats are the only ones that can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the lion's roar, but like a few words (not a complete sentence) with a growl (like a cat) but not a purr.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: الخلية هي أصغر وحدة هيكلية ووظيفية كاينة في الكائن الحي (الأشياء). كلمة الخليّة جايا من الكلمة اللاتينية cella واللي معناها غرفةٌ صغيرةٌ. إذا حطيتي كائنات حية تحت المجهر، فغادي تلاحظ أنها مكوّنة من مربعات أو كرات صغيرة. عالم البولوجيا النكليزي شاف مربعات صغار فالفرشي بالميكروسكوب. تيبانوا فحال البيوتا كان أول شخص تيْراقب الخلايا الميتة
mt: A cell is the smallest unit of life. The word cell comes from the Latin word cella, meaning small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small squares or balls. The Dutchman Anton van Leeuwenhoek was the first person to observe dead cells
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: كتتكون الحيوانات من بزاف ديال الخلايا. كياكلوا شي حاجات وكيهضموها لداخل. كاع الحيوانات كتقدر تتحرك. غير الحيوانات اللي عندها الدماغ (واخا ماشي كاع الحيوانات عندهم؛ بحال قنديل البحر كاع معندو الدماغ). كاينين الحيوانات في جميع أنحاء الأرض. كيحفروا في الأرض وكيعوموا في المحيطات وكيطيروا في السما.
mt: Animals are made up of cells. They eat things and break them down inside. All animals can move. Not all animals have brains (like jellyfish don't have one). There are animals all over the Earth. They dig in the ground and swim in the oceans and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: النباتات كتعكي الأوكسيجين اللي تيدخلوه البشر للرية ديالهم وكتاخد تنائي أوكسيد الكربون اللي تيخرجوه (تيتنفسوه على برى). الباتات كتتغذى من الشمس باستعمال الفوطوسانتاز. وتيعطيو حتى الظل. بيوتنا كنبنيوهم مَن النباتات و حْوايجنا كنصنعوهم من النباتات و الأغلبية ديال الماكلا لّي كناكلو حتا هي نباتات. بلا نباتات، الحيوانات ميمكنش إعيشو.
mt: Plants take in oxygen that humans exhale and take in carbon dioxide that humans exhale (breathe out). Potatoes use sunlight to make food. They even give shade. Our homes are built from plants and most of our food is made from plants. Without plants, animals cannot live.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: فاش واحد المجموعة صغيره ديال الكائنات الحية كتنفصَل على النوع الأصلي ديالها منين جات (مثلا ايلا انتقلو عبر الجبال أولا شي واد اولا مشاو لشي جزيرة فين ميمكنش يرجعو)، فغالباً غادي يلقاو راسهوم فواحد البيئة مَختالفا على لّي كانو فيها من قبل. هاد البيئة الجديدة فيها موارد ومنافسين مختلفين، لهادا, الساكنة الجديدة غادي تحتاج مميزات أولا تعديلات فالسكن مختلفة على اللي كانت عندها من قبل باش تولِّ منافس قوي. الشعب الأصلي مازال متبدلش كاع، خاصهم نفس التعديلات بحال اللول. مع الوقت وفاش كيبداو السكان جداد يتأقلمو مع المحيط الجديد ديالهم تيبداو يبانو بحالهم بحال السكان لوخرين. في النهاية، بعد آلاف أو حتى ملايين السنين، غادي تكون المجموعات بجوج مختلفين إلى الحد اللي ما يمكنش نقولوا باللي راهم من نفس النوع. كنسميو هاد العملية بالانتواع و لّي كتعني التكوين ديال أنواع جديدة. و الانتواع هو واحد العملية لّي ميمكنش نهربو منها و هو جزء ضروري بزاف فالتطور.
mt: When a small group of organisms moves away from its original habitat (for example, if they cross mountains or a river and then move to an island where they can't return), they will often find themselves in a different environment. This new environment has different resources and competitors, so the new settlers will need different adaptations or modifications in their habitat to compete effectively. The original population has not changed yet, because they still have the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new settlers become accustomed to their new environment, they will begin to look like the original population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two groups will be so different that we can't say they are the same species. We call this process speciation and it means the creation of new species. And speciation is an irreversible process that is an essential part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: لعضو الرئيسي نتاع نظم دوران الدم هو القلب، وهو اللي تيضخ الدم. كيمشي الدم بعيد من القلب في أنابيب كتسمى الشرايين وكيرجع للقلب في أنابيب كتسمى الأوردة. الأنابيب الصغيرة كتسمى الشعيرات الدموية.
mt: The main organ involved in blood circulation is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood flows from the heart in arteries and returns to the heart in veins. The smallest blood vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: وكانت الحشرات أول حيوان تطير في الهواء. عاوناتهم لقدرة نتاعهم على الطيران أنهم يهربو من الأعداء بسهولة أكبر ويلقاو لماكلة والأزواج على واحد النحو أكثر كفاءة. أغلب الحشرات قادرة أنها تخزن جناحها مورا ظهرها. هاد شي تيعطيهم عدد كتير من الأماكن الصغيرة باش يتخباو من الحيوانات المفترسة. اليوم، الحشرات الوحيده لّي ميمكنش تطوي جناحها هي اليعسوب و ذبانة مايو.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. Their ability to fly allowed them to escape predators more easily and to find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects are able to fold their wings along their backs. This gives them many small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insect that cannot fold its wings is the dragonfly and mayfly.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: بزاف دعلماء الحفريات تيآمنو أن واحد المجموعة دالدينصورات عاشو ومازالين عايشين اليوم. وتنسميوهوم الطيور. بزاف دالناس متيشوفوهمش كدينصورات لاحقاش عندهم الريش وتيطيرو. لكن كاين الكثير من الأشياء حول الطيور اللي لا تزال تبدو بحال الديناصورات. عندهم أقدام/ رجلين فيها القشور أو الضفار/ مخالب، تيحطوا البيض ،أوتيمشيوا على رجليهم اللُّرانيِّين فحال T-Rex.
mt: A group of paleontologists believe a group of dinosaurs lived and are still living today. They call them birds. Many people don't think of them as dinosaurs because they don't have feathers and don't fly. But there are many things about birds that still look like dinosaurs. They have claws or talons, lay eggs, and walk on their hind legs like T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: كانت أسنان التريسيراتوبس قادرة باش تسحق ماشي غير الأوراق ولكن حتى الفروع والجذور اللي قاصحة بزاف. كيظنو شي علماء أن الترايسيراتوبس كان تياكل السيكاسيات وهي نوع من النباتات اللي كان شايع فالعصر الطباشيري. هاد نباتات كتبان بحال شي شجيرة دنخل شكلها بحال التاج فيه وراق مشوكين. كان يقدر ترايسيراتوبس يستخدم المنقار دياله القوي باش يحيد الأوراق قبل ما ياكل الجذع. علماء أخرين تيناقشو أن هاد النباتات جد سامة وميمكنش تكون الديناصورات كلاتها، واخا اليوم الكسلانيات وحيوانات أخرين بحال الببغاء (اللي جاو من الديناصورات) قادرين ياكلو أوراق وفواكه مسمومة.
mt: The teeth of the triceratops were capable of not only crushing leaves, but also branches and roots. Some scientists believe the triceratops ate cycads, a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous period. These plants were shrub-like, with spiky leaves. The triceratops could use its powerful beak to strip the leaves before eating the stem. Other scientists have questioned whether these plants were actually poisonous and whether the dinosaurs could eat them, although today, cassowaries and other animals such as parrots (which evolved from dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves and fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: كرة القدم الوطنية الإيطالية، إلى جانب المنتخب الألماني لكرة القدم هي ثاني أكثر الفرق اللي ناجحين فالعالم وربحو كأس العالم لكرة القدم في عام 2006. من بين الرياضات المشهورة كاينة كرة القدم ولباسكيط والفوليبال وكرة دلما والمبارزة بالسيف والريكبي وركوب الدراجات والآيس هوكي والهوكي وسباق السياراتF1. الرياضات تيكونو مشهورين بزاف فلمناطق الشمالية اللي تيكونو فيها لإيطاليين تيتنافسو على ألعاب دولية وتضاهرات أولمبية.
mt: Italian national football team, along with the German national football team, is the second most successful team in the world and won the FIFA World Cup in 2006. Among the popular sports are football, basketball, volleyball, tennis, fencing, cycling, ice hockey, hockey, and Formula One. Sports are popular in the northern regions where Italians compete in international competitions and Olympic games.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: لوكسمبورغ عندها تاريخ طويل وخا خدات الاستقلال ديالها ف 1839. ليبارتي الي كاينين اليوم فبلجيكا كانو فلوكسمبورغ شحال هادي ولكن ولاو ديال بلجيكا من بعد الثورة البلجيكية فسنوات 1830. حاولات لوكسمبورغ تبقا دولة محايدة ولكن استعمراتها ألمانيا فالحرب العالمية الأواى والثانية بجوج. في عام 1957 ولات لوكسمبورغ عضو مؤسس في المنظمة اللي معروفة اليوم بالاتحاد الأوروبي.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history and gained its independence in 1839. The party that is today in Belgium were in Luxembourg at the time but were taken by Belgium after the Belgian Revolution in the years 1830. Luxembourg tried to remain neutral but was occupied by Germany in both World War I and World War II. In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is known today as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: تركيا الأوروبية (تراقيا الشرقية أو روميليا في شبه جزيرة البلقان) كتضم 3% من البلاد. كيبلغ طول أراضي تركيا كتر من ألف أو سْتَمية/ 1600كيلومتر (1000/ألف ميل) و العرض ديالها تمْنَمية/800 كيلومتر (500/خمسمية ميل) ، على شكل مستطيل تقريبًا. المِساحة ديال تركيا، داخلا فيها حتّا البحيرات، كتوصل ل 783562 كيلومتر مربع، مَنَّها 755688 كيلومتر مربع ف جنوب غرب آسيا و 23764 كيلومتر مربع فأوروبا. - المساحة ديال تركيا كتخلّيها تكون فالمرتيه 37 من بين أكبر الدول، تقريبا قٍد المساحة ديال فرانسا و المملكة المتحدة. تركيا دايرين بيها تلاتتْ البحور من تلاتتْ الجوايه: بْحر إيجه مَن الغرب و البحر الأسود من الشمال و البحر الأبيض المتوسط من الجنوب.
mt: 3% of Turkey's land is in Europe (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula). Turkey's length is more than 1600 kilometers (1000 miles) and its width is 800 kilometers (500 miles), approximately a rectangle. The area of Turkey, including lakes, is 783562 square kilometers, 755688 square kilometers in southwestern Asia and 23764 square kilometers in Europe. - The area of Turkey leaves it in the 37th place among the largest countries, approximately the area of France and the United Kingdom. Turkey is bordered by three seas from three continents: the Aegean Sea from the west, the Black Sea from the north, and the Mediterranean Sea from the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: تركيا الأوروبية (تراقيا الشرقية أو روميليا في شبه جزيرة البلقان) كتضم 3% من البلاد. كيبلغ طول أراضي تركيا كتر من ألف أو سْتَمية/ 1600كيلومتر (1000/ألف ميل) و العرض ديالها تمْنَمية/800 كيلومتر (500/خمسمية ميل) ، على شكل مستطيل تقريبًا. المِساحة ديال تركيا، داخلا فيها حتّا البحيرات، كتوصل ل 783562 كيلومتر مربع، مَنَّها 755688 كيلومتر مربع ف جنوب غرب آسيا و 23764 كيلومتر مربع فأوروبا. - المساحة ديال تركيا كتخلّيها تكون فالمرتيه 37 من بين أكبر الدول، تقريبا قٍد المساحة ديال فرانسا و المملكة المتحدة. تركيا دايرين بيها تلاتتْ البحور من تلاتتْ الجوايه: بْحر إيجه مَن الغرب و البحر الأسود من الشمال و البحر الأبيض المتوسط من الجنوب.
mt: 3% of Turkey's land is in Europe (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula). Turkey's length is more than 1600 kilometers (1000 miles) and its width is 800 kilometers (500 miles), approximately a rectangle. The area of Turkey, including lakes, is 783562 square kilometers, 755688 square kilometers in southwestern Asia and 23764 square kilometers in Europe. - The area of Turkey leaves it in the 37th place among the largest countries, approximately the area of France and the United Kingdom. Turkey is bordered by three seas from three continents: the Aegean Sea from the west, the Black Sea from the north, and the Mediterranean Sea from the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: مدينتْ الفاتيكان فيها تقريبا شي تمان ميا (800) واحد، و هي أصغر مدينا مستقله فالعالم و لي فيها أقل عدد ديال السكان. مدينت الفاتيكان كتهدر بالطاليانيه فالتشريعات و التواصل الرسمي. الإيطاليّة أيضاً هي لغة الحياة اليوميّة اللي كيستخدموها معظم اللي تيخدمو فالدولة، بينما كتتستخدم اللاتينيّة عادةً في المراسم الدينيّة. المواطنين ديال مدينة الفاتيكان كلهم من الروم الكاثوليك.
mt: Vatican City is an independent city-state inside Rome, Italy. It has an area of approximately 0.44 square miles (1.2 km2), and a population of about 800. Vatican City is the smallest internationally recognized independent state in the world by both area and population. Italian is the official language of Vatican City, although Latin is also used in official ceremonies. Italian is also the language used for everyday life, while Latin is used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: كتتسخدم لبيسيات اليوم باش تعالج التصاور والفيديوات. يمكن إنشاء رسوم متحركة متطورة على الكمبيونر، وكيستخدم هاد النوع من الرسوم المتحركة بزاف في التلفزيون والأفلام. الموسيقى ديما كتتسجل بكومبيوترات متطورة باش تتعالج الأصوات وتتدمج مع بعض.
mt: 3D graphics are used in computer games, movies, and television. Music is recorded on advanced computers to process and mix sounds.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: مدن هاربا و موهينجو دارو لهم حمامات بسيفون في كل دار موصلة بنظام صرف معقد. تلقاو بقايا أنظمة الصرف الصحي فالديور نتاع مدن مينوان الكريتي والسانتورينية فاليونان. كانو طواليطات حتى فمصر القديمة وبلادفارس والصين. كانو طواليطات فلحضارة رومانية تيكونو فلحمامات لعمومية اللي كانو تيتخالطو فيها رجال وعيالات.
mt: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo Daro had sophisticated sewage systems connected to each house. Remains of sewage systems were found in the cities of Miletus and Ephesus in Turkey. They were used in Ancient Egypt, Persia and China. They were used in Roman public baths where men and women mixed.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: السلاح ديال متزلج جديد له حدان مع تجويف بينهما. الحدان يجعلو التزلج اكثر ثباتا حتي مع الانحناء على ود الجزء السفلي ديال الشفرة شوية مثني، باش تميل لجهة أو أخرى، كتكون الجهة اللي كتقيس الجليد من تحت حتى هي مثنية. هادشي كيتسبب في دوران المتزلج. إذا كانت الزلاجات مايلة على ليمين ،را المتزلج غيدور لليمين ، و إلا كانت مايلة عل ليسر المتزلج غادي يبدل لْ ليسر.
mt: The new skis have two edges with a groove between them. The edges make the skiing more stable even with a slight bend at the bottom of the blade, so that one side or the other is bent. This causes the skier to turn. If the skis are tilted to the left, the skier will turn to the left, and if they are tilted to the right, the skier will turn to the right.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "باش يرجعو للمستوى ديال الطاقة اللي كان، خاصهم يتخلصو من الطاقة الزايدا اللي خداوها من الضوو. كيديروا داك شي عن طريق انبعاث واحد الجسيم صغير ديال الضو كيتسمى أ ""الفوتون"". تيسميو العلماء هاد العملية ""النبعاث المحفز للأشعة"" لاحقاش الضو لخفيف تيحفز الذرات تيسبب انبعاث فوتون نتاع الضو، والضو هو نوع من الأشعة. تصويرة اللي جاية كتبين واحد الذرة كتصيفط فوتونات. بطبيعة الحال الفوتونات صغار بزاف على داكشي اللي باين فالتصاور. الفوتونات صغار حتى من المادة اللي كتكون الذرات!"
mt: "To get back to the level of energy they had, they need to get rid of the excess energy they took from the light. They do this by emitting a small particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" where the low-energy light causes atoms to emit photons of light, and light is a type of radiation. The images below show an atom emitting photons. Of course, the photons are much smaller than what is shown in the images. The photons are so small that they are smaller than the atoms!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: من بعد شحال من مائة ساعة ديال الخدمة، غادي تتحرق الفتيلة اللي كاينة في اللمبة في التالي ومغاديش تبقى اللمبة خدامة. خاس تبدل البولة نتاع الضو. ضروري نردو لبال فاش نبغيو نبدلو لبولة نتاع الضو. أولاً، خاص تطفي مفتاح المصباح أو تفصل الكابل. هاد شي لأنه الضو اللي جاي لْ البريز فين داك الطرف ديال المعدن من البولة تيكون, يمكن ليه يسبب ليك صدمة كهربائية مجهدة إلا قستِ الجزء الدخلاني ديال البريز أو القاعدة المعدنية ديال البولة بينما هو مزال شوية لاصق فالبريز.
mt: 100 hours after installation, the bulb in the next lamp will burn out and the lamp will not work. You need to change the bulb of the lamp. First, turn off the light switch or disconnect the power cord. This is because the electricity coming to the brass part of the plug, can cause you to receive an electric shock if you are still slightly stuck in the plug or the metal base of the bulb while it is still slightly stuck in the plug.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: القنبلة الانقسامية كتخدم على مبدأ أنها كتاخد الطاقة باش تجمع النواة مع بزاف دلبروتونات والنوترونات. نوع من متل دحرجة عربة ثقيلة أعلى التل. كيؤدي تقسيم النواة مرة أخرى إلى إطلاق شوية من هاد الطاقة. شي ذرات عندهوم واحد النوية مامستقراش واللي تتقسم باستمرار ساو كان شوية دالزعزعة أولا مكانتش.
mt: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to hold the nucleus together with a few protons and neutrons. A kind of heavy truck wheel rolling down a hill. To do this again, the nucleus is split, releasing some of this energy. A nucleus with an unstable nucleus that has not yet settled down.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: باش تتّصل بشي واحد لي بعيد عليك بآلاف الكيلومطرات فراك كتستعمل القمر الصناعي. الساتيليت اللي فلفضاء كتوصلو لمكالمة وتيردها فلبلاصة. واحد الصاروخ هو اللي صيفط الساتيليت للفضاء. لعلماء تيخدمو تيليسكوب فلفضلاء لاحقاش لجو نتاع لأرض تيضيع الضو والشوفة ديالنا. كيتطلب الأمر صاروخاً كبير لارتفاع ديالو أكثر من 100 قدم باش يتحط قمر اصطناعي أو منظار في الفضاء.
mt: To call someone who is far away, you use a satellite. A satellite is a man-made object that orbits Earth. It is used to make phone calls and send messages. A rocket is what sends a satellite into space. Scientists use a telescope to look at the atmosphere of Earth. It requires a large rocket to launch a satellite or telescope into space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: الوقت هو واحد الحاجات لي كابنا فينما مشيتي، و لي كيأثر على أي حاجا كنديروها. واخّا هاكاك صعيب باش نفهموه. الوقت قراو عليه العلماء ديال الدين و الفلسفه و الباحثين قبل آلاف السنين. كنعيشو الوقت بحال شي سلسلة ديال الأحداث لي جايا من المستقبل للحاضر للماضي. كنعيشو الوقت بحال شي سلسلة ديال الأحداث لي جايا من المستقبل للحاضر للماضي. تقدر تشد لحساب دلوقت لراسك وتبقا تلاحظ لمعاودة نتاع شي ظاهرة دورية. الظاهرة الدورية هي شي حاجة اللي كتوقع وتعاود توقع بشكل منتاظم.
mt: Time is one of the things that we can't see while walking, and that affects any thing we do.  It is hard to understand.  Time was studied by scientists of religion, philosophy and research thousands of years ago.  We live time as a series of events that came from the future to the present to the past.  We live time as a series of events that came from the future to the present to the past.  You can calculate the time to your head and continue to observe the recurrence of a periodic phenomenon.  The periodic phenomenon is something that is expected and expected in a regular manner.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

mt: Time is one of the things that we can't see while walking, and that affects any thing we do.  It is hard to understand.  Time was studied by scientists of religion, philosophy and research thousands of years ago.  We live time as a series of events that came from the future to the present to the past.  We live time as a series of events that came from the future to the present to the past.  You can calculate the time to your head and continue to observe the recurrence of a periodic phenomenon.  The periodic phenomenon is something that is expected and expected in a regular manner.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: كيفما العاده، هاداك لّي كيشد الحُكم كيمشي مباشره للجيش من بعدما يسالي القرايا. تشارلز حضر الجامعة في كلية ترينتي في كامبردج فين قرا الأنتروبولوجيا وعلم الآثار والتاريخ، ومن بعد خدا 2:2 (المرتبة الدنيا الثانية). كان الأمير تشارلز أول فرد في العائلة الملكية البريطانية كيشد شهادة علمية.
mt: As usual, the heir to the throne immediately joined the army after completing his studies. Charles attended the University of Cambridge, where he read anthropology, archaeology and history, and then received a 2:2 (the lowest second class). The Prince of Wales was the first member of the British royal family to receive a university degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: انكلترا عاشت فترة طويلة من السّلام من بعد الغزو ديال دانلو. ومع ذلك، ففي سنة 991 تواجهات إيذلريد بواحد أسطول الفايكينغ هو الأكبر من قرن الغوثروم الغابر. كان هاد الأسطول بقيادة Olaf Trygvasson أولاف تريغفاسون ، هو نرويجي بغا يرجع بلادو من الإستعمار/الاحتلال الدنماركي /الهيمنة الدنماركية. من بعد النكسات العسكرية الاولى، قدر إثيلريد يتفق مع أولاف، اللي رجع للنرويج ياش يحاول يربح المملكة دياله بواحد نجاح مخلط.
mt: England had a long period of peace after the Danish invasion. However, in 991, Ethelred was faced with the largest Viking fleet of the Guthrum century. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian who was returning to his homeland from Danish occupation. After the first military successes, Ethelred agreed with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to regain his kingdom with mixed success.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "في حوالي القرن الخمستاش، كان شمال إستونيا متأثر بزاف بألمانيا تقافيا. شي رهبان ألمانيين ختارعو اللغة الإستونية الحرفية لاحقاش بغاو يقربو الله من الناس الأصليين. كانت مؤسسة عل الحروف الألمانية وتزاد واحد الحرف ""Õ/õ"". ومع الوقت، يزاف ديال الكلمات اللي جاية من الألمانية اندمجت. وكانت هذه هي البداية ديال التنوير."
mt: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was influenced by Germany culturally. German monks invented the Estonian written language later on in order to bring God closer to the indigenous people. The German institution of letters and added the letter ""Õ/õ"". Over time, words that came from German were assimilated. This was the beginning of the Enlightenment."
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: كابن تقديرات مختالفة على شحال دناس تيهضرو لهندية. وكيتقال أنها ممكن تكون بين ثاني أو رابع لغة اللي كيهضرو بيها الناس فالعالم. كيختالف عدد المتكلمين الأصليين بواش الدارجات اللي متقاربين محسوبين ولا لا. وكتراوح التقديرات بين 340 مليون و500 مليون متحدث، تيوصل حتال 800 مليون واحد قادرين يفهمو اللغة. كيتشابهو اللغتين الهندية والأردية في المفردات واكن مختلفين في الكتابة. ففي المحادثات اليومية، يمكن للمتكلمين أنهم يفهمو بعض واخا من اللغتين بجوج.
mt: Estimates vary widely on how many people speak Hindi. It is said to be between the second and fourth most spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers is counted or not counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, up to 800 million who can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu share many words but are different in writing. In everyday conversations, speakers can understand each other even if they are speaking Hindi or Urdu.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: "الهانجول هي الأبجدية الوحيدة اللي اخترعت عن قصد في الاستخدام اليومي الشعبي عام 1444 في عهد الملك سيجونج (1418 - 1450). الملك سيجونغ هو رابع ملك فسلالة جوسون وهو اللي تيتم التدير ديالو بزاف. الأبجدية الهنجولية كانت كتسمى في البداية ""هانمن جيونجوم""، أي ""الأصوات الصحيحة لتوجيه الناس""."
mt: "Hangul is the only alphabet ever created for everyday popular use in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418-1450). King Sejong was the fourth ruler of the Joseon dynasty and is credited with overseeing its administration. The Hangul alphabet was originally called ""Hahmum Jeongeum"", or ""Correct Sounds to Guide the People."""
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: كاين بزاف نتاع النظريات على كيفاش جات السنسكريتية. وحدة كنهضر على هجرة نتاع واحد لأريان من الغرب للهند واللي جابو معهم اللغة ديالهم. السانسكريتية لغة قديمة وكتقارن باللغة اللاتينية اللي تيهضرو بها فأروربا. أقدم كتاب معروف فالعالم تكتب بالسنسكريتية. تلاشات السنسكريتية من بعد ما تجمع الأوبنيشاد بسبب التدرج. السانسكريتية لغة مقعدة وغنية اللي كانت المصدر نتاع بزاف داللغات الهندية بحال كيفما اللاتينية هي المصدر نتاع لغات بحال لفرونسي والسبنيولية.
mt: There are several theories on how Sanskrit came to be. One theory is that it was brought by an Aryan migration from the west to India and brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and can be compared to Latin which is spoken in Europe. The oldest known book in the world is written in Sanskrit. Sanskrit declined after the Upanishads were collected because of the degeneration. Sanskrit is a dead and rich language that was the source of many Indian languages such as how Latin is the source of languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: كيفاش غتجبدني جاذبية أيو؟ إذا وقفت على سطح أيو، غيولي لوزن ديالك قل من وهو فوق الأرض. الشخص الذي يزن 200 رطل (90 كجم) على الأرض يزن حوالي 36 رطلاً (16 كجم) على Io. لذا فإن الجاذبية بالطبع لا تشدك كثيرًا.
mt: How does gravity work on Io? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kilograms) on Earth weighs about 36 pounds (16 kilograms) on Io. So, of course, gravity doesn't pull you very hard.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: لوجه نتاع لقمر فيه لحجر ولغبرة. كتسمى لقشرة ابرانية نتاع لقمر كراست. سمك القشرة كاين حوالي 70 كيلومترًا في الجانب لقريب وسمكها 100 كيلومتر في الجانب لبعيد. هو ضعيف تحت ماريا وغليض تحت المرتفعات. غاتكون لماريا زايدة فجيهة لقريبة لاحقاش لكراست تيكون رقيق. كان ساهل أن الافا تطلع.
mt: The moon's far side has a large, dark area called the South Pole-Aitken basin. The basin is about 2,500 kilometers across and 13 kilometers deep. It is weak under the mare and thick under the highlands. The mare may be higher in the future as the crust becomes thinner. It was once possible to see the far side of the moon.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "بزاف دالناس تيحلمو بداك النهار اللي فيه الإنسان يقدر يسافر لنجم أخر ويكتشف عوالم أخرى، وبعض الناس تيقولو أشنو ممكن يكون على برا فالفضاء شي وحدين تيقولو كاينين الفضائيين ولا شي كل أخر للحياة فكوكب أخر. ولكن، يلا وقع هاذشي على الأرجح، ما غاديش يوقع مرة أخرى لفترة طويلة بزاف. النجوم منتشرة بزاف لدرجة أنه كاين تريليونات الأميال ما بين النجوم اللي كتعتبر ""جيران"". ممكن فواحد النهار أن شي واحد فحفادك يوقف فعالم فضائي وتيفكر فالأسلاف لقدام ديالو."
mt: "Many people dream of that day when man can travel to another star and discover other worlds, and some people say that there are aliens or that there is life on another planet. However, if this happens, it will not happen again for a long time. Stars are spread out so much that there are trillions of miles between stars that are considered "neighbors". One day, your descendant may stop at a space world and think about his ancestors."
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "الشمس معندهاش شي قشرة اللي يقدر لواحد يوفق فوقها بحال الأرض. الشمس كلها غازات وعافية وبلازما. كتزاد لكثافة نتاع الغاز كلما بعدنا كتر من مركز الشمس. الجيهة لبرانية اللي تنشوفو فالشمس كتسمى لفوطوسفير، اللي كتعني ""كرة دالضو""."
mt: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth does. The Sun is all gases, plasma, and heat. The density of the gas increases as we get farther from the Sun's center. The region we see on the Sun is called the photosphere, which means'sphere of light'."
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: من بعد تقريبا ثلاثة آلاف عام، في عام 1610، استخدم عالم الفلك الإيطالي جاليليو جاليلي تلسكوب باش يشوف واش كوكب الزهرة عنده أطوار بحال القمر. كتوقع الأطوار لاحقاش لجانب نتاع كوكب الزهرة (أو القمر) اللي مقابل مع الشمس تيكون مضوي. الأطوار نتاع كوكب الزهرة كتدعم نظرية كوبرنيك ديال أن الكواكب كتدور على الشمس. ومن بعد شي سنوات مورا 1639 شاف واحد رائد لفضاء بريطاني سميتو جيريمي هوروكس واحد العبور نتاع كوكب الزهرة.
mt: 1610: Galileo Galilei, Italian astronomer, uses a telescope to observe the phases of Venus, as predicted by Copernican theory that planets orbit the Sun. 1639: British astronaut Jeremy Horrocks observes a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

mt: 1610: Galileo Galilei, Italian astronomer, uses a telescope to observe the phases of Venus, as predicted by Copernican theory that planets orbit the Sun. 1639: British astronaut Jeremy Horrocks observes a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: نهر الأمازون هو ثاني أطول وأكبر نهر على وجه الأرض. كيهز أكثر من 8 أضعاف كمية المياه اللي يهزها ثاني أكبر نهر. الأمازون حتا هو أوسع نهر على وجه الأرض، حيث لعرض ديالو كيوصل شي مرات ستة دلأميال. 20 في المائة من المياه اللي كتصب من أنهار الكوكب في المحيطات جاية من الأمازون. الواد دأمازون فيه 6,378 كيلومتر (3,980 ميل). تيجمع لما نتاع آلاف الويدان الصغار.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest and largest river on Earth. It carries more than eight times the volume of water of the second largest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, where its width reaches six times the distance of the Delaware River. Twenty percent of the world's fresh water flows into the oceans from the Amazon. The Amazon River is 6,378 kilometers (3,980 miles) long. It drains thousands of small rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: ثمنتاش في المائة من الفنزويليين ماخدامينش، وأغلبية اللي خدامين تيكونو غير فالنوار. التلت ديال الفنزوليين كيخدمو فالقطاع ديال الخدمات و تقريباً الربع ديالهم كيخدمو فالصناعه و الخمس كيخدم فالفلاحه. النفط هو من الصناعات المهمة بالنسبة للفنزويليين، حيث الدولة كتعتبر مصدر ديال الخام، واخا راه واحد في المائة فقط اللي كيخدموا في صناعة النفط.
mt: 100% of Venezuelans are employed, and the majority of those who are employed are in the service sector. About 25% of Venezuelans are employed in manufacturing and 5% are employed in agriculture. Oil is one of the most important industries for Venezuelans, where the state considers the source of the crude, although only 1% of those employed are in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: كتطلق النجوم الضو و الحرارة لانها ديال ذرات هيدروجين متحدة لتكوين عنصر تقيل. تيحاولو العلماء يختارعو مفاعل قادر ينتج الطاقة بنفس الطريقة. ومع ذلك ، را هادي مشكلة صعيب الحل ديالها أو خاصها سنوات عديدة قبل ما نشوفو بناء مفاعلات اندماج مفيدة.
mt: Stars emit light and heat as hydrogen atoms fuse to form helium. Scientists are trying to invent a reactor that produces energy in the same way. However, this is a difficult problem to solve or will take years before we see useful fusion reactors.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: كتطلق النجوم الضو و الحرارة لانها ديال ذرات هيدروجين متحدة لتكوين عنصر تقيل. تيحاولو العلماء يختارعو مفاعل قادر ينتج الطاقة بنفس الطريقة. ومع ذلك ، را هادي مشكلة صعيب الحل ديالها أو خاصها سنوات عديدة قبل ما نشوفو بناء مفاعلات اندماج مفيدة.

src: العناصر والمركبات قادرة أنها تنتاقل من حالة إلى أخرى بلا متتغير. غاز النيتروجين عندو نفس الخاصيات بحال النيتروجين السائل. حالة السائل كثيفة ولكن الجزيئات بحال بحال. الما هو واحد المثال أخر. كيتكون الما من جوج ذرات ديال الهيدروجين و ذره وحدت ديال الأكسجين. كيهز التركيب الجزيئي راسو سواء كان في حالة غازية، أو سائلة، أو صلبة. واخا الحالة الفيزيائية دياله تقدر تتغير، ولكن حالته الكيميائية كتبقى كيفما هي.
mt: Elements and compounds can change from one state to another without changing their properties. Nitrogen gas has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. Water is made of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. The molecular structure remains the same whether it is in a gaseous, liquid, or solid state. Although its physical state can change, its chemical state remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: منين كانت الحرب الثورية، شكلت الولايات الثلثاش في الاول حكومة مركزية ضعيفة ـ وكان الكونغرس كيشكل العنصر الوحيد فيها ـ في ظل النظام الأساسي للاتحاد الفيدرالي. كان الكونجرس كيفتقر لأي سلطة باش يفرض الضرائب، وبسبب انه ما كايناش سلطة تنفيذية وطنية أو قضائية، فهو اعتمد على سلطات الدولة، اللي كانت في الغالب غير متعاونة، باش تفرض القوانين دياله كلها. بالإضافة إلى ذلك، معندهاش سلطة باش تتجاوز القوانين الضريبيّة والتعريفات اللي كاينة بين الولايات. تطلبت القوانين موافقة الجميع من كل الولايات قبل باش يتوافق عليهم و استهترت الولايات بالادارة المركزية لان لممثلين ديالهم كانو غايبين.
mt: During the Revolutionary War, the Thirteen States formed a weak central government — the Congress was the only federal element — under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked the power to levy taxes, and because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state governments to enforce its laws, which were often uncooperative. In addition, it lacked the power to override state tax laws and tariff definitions. Laws required unanimous approval from all states before they could be agreed upon, and states disdained the central administration because their representatives were absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: "إذا كنت تفرجتي ففيلم الكنز الوطني، غادي تقول أن خريطة كنز تكتبات على ظهر د وتيقة الاستقلال. لكن هاشي ماشي صحيح. واخا كاينة شي حاجة مكتوبة على الظهر دالمستند، فهو ماشي خريطة د لكنز. كان مكتوب فالظهر نتاع وثيقة لستقلال ""وثيقة لستقلال الأصلية ف 4 يوليز 1776"". لكتابة كاينة فلتحت نتاع لورقة، مقلوبة. حتى واحد مامتأكد شكون اللي كتبها، كانت لوثيقة دلمخطوطات لكبيرة (لقياس ديالها 29¾ إنش على 24½ إنش) كتغلف باش تتخزن من بكري. إذا غالبا أيكون الرمز تزاد على أساس يكون علامة."
mt: "If you watched the movie National Treasure, you may have said the map to the treasure was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. But that's not true. Even if there was something written on the back of the document, it was not a map to the treasure. The writing was on the bottom of the document, upside down. Even the author is unknown, the document was one of the large manuscripts (29¾ inches by 24½ inches) that were rolled up to be stored in a box. It was probably based on a symbol to be a sign."
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: في بداية استقلال البلاد، ساعدت خبرة حدائق سنغافورة النباتية في تحويل الجزيرة إلى مدينة من الحدائق الاستوائية. في سنة 1981 تختار فاندا ميس جوكويم، وهو عبارة عن هجين أوركيد، كزهرة وطنية للبلاد.
mt: In the early years of independence, Singapore's horticultural expertise helped transform the island into a city of tropical gardens. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, a hybrid orchid, was chosen as the national flower of the country.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: واخا بقاو كيبنيو الأهرامات بالحجر حتى تسالات الدولة القديمة، ولكن أهرامات الجيزة حتى حاجة ما قدرت تتفوق عليها من حيث الحجم والتميز الفني في البني ديالها. تعجبو المصريين القدام في عصر الدولة الحديثة من الآثار دلأسلاف ديالهم، واللي كان عمرها كثر من ألف عام ديك الساعة.
mt: While the pyramids of Giza were built of stone, the Great Pyramid of Giza was the only one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World that remained standing until the modern state was established. The Egyptians of the Old Kingdom were awed by the monuments of their ancestors, which were over a thousand years old at the time.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: كييهاجر حوالي 1.5 مليون من الحيوانات العاشبة في شهر أكتوبر كل عام إلى السهول الجنوبية، وتيدوزو على واد مارا، من التلال الشمالية باش يوصلو للشتا. ومن بعد كترجع للشمال من خلال الغرب، مرة أخرى من خلال واد مارا، من بعد ما طاحت الشتا في أبريل تقريبا. منطقة سيرينجيتي فيها لبارك لوطني نتاع سيرينجيتي ولمحمية نتاع نغورونغورو ومحمية ماسوا فطنزانيا ولمحمية لوطنية نتاع مساي مارا ف كينيا.
mt: 1.5 million wildebeest migrate south in October every year to the southern plains, and converge on the Mara River, from the northern hills to reach the short grasses. After the short grasses have been eaten, they return north through the west, again through the Mara River, after the short grasses have been eaten in April. The Serengeti National Park in Tanzania, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, the Masai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: كييهاجر حوالي 1.5 مليون من الحيوانات العاشبة في شهر أكتوبر كل عام إلى السهول الجنوبية، وتيدوزو على واد مارا، من التلال الشمالية باش يوصلو للشتا. ومن بعد كترجع للشمال من خلال الغرب، مرة أخرى من خلال واد مارا، من بعد ما طاحت الشتا في أبريل تقريبا. منطقة سيرينجيتي فيها لبارك لوطني نتاع سيرينجيتي ولمحمية نتاع نغورونغورو ومحمية ماسوا فطنزانيا ولمحمية لوطنية نتاع مساي مارا ف كينيا.

src: "فاش تسالات لمعركة فرنسا، بدات ألمانيا كتوجد راسها باش تستعمر جزيرة بريطانيا. أطلقت ألمانيا على الهجوم الاسم السري ""عملية أسد البحر"". فَقَد الجيش البريطاني معظم أسلحته الثقيلة وإمداداته عند إجلائه من دونكيرك، على ذاكشي فقد كان ضعيفاً إلى حدٍ كبير. ولكن البحرية الملكية كانت مازال قوية بزاف من البحرية الألمانية (""كريغسمارينه"") وكانت تقدر تدمر أي أسطول غزو كيجي من القناة الإنجليزية. واخا داكشي، تمركز عدد صغير من سفن البحرية الملكية حدا طرق الغزو المحتملة بينما كان الأدميرالات خايفين من أنهم يغرقوا بسبب الهجوم الجوي الألماني."
mt: "When the Battle of France began, Germany started planning to invade the island of Britain. Germany launched the secret operation "Operation Sealion". The British Army had lost most of its heavy weapons and supplies when it was evacuated from Dunkirk, so it was very weak. However, the Royal Navy was still stronger than the German Navy ("Kriegsmarine") and could have destroyed any invasion fleet trying to cross the English Channel. Nevertheless, a small number of Royal Navy ships were stationed at the most likely invasion routes while the admirals were afraid of being sunk by the German air force."
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: "فاش تسالات لمعركة فرنسا، بدات ألمانيا كتوجد راسها باش تستعمر جزيرة بريطانيا. أطلقت ألمانيا على الهجوم الاسم السري ""عملية أسد البحر"". فَقَد الجيش البريطاني معظم أسلحته الثقيلة وإمداداته عند إجلائه من دونكيرك، على ذاكشي فقد كان ضعيفاً إلى حدٍ كبير. ولكن البحرية الملكية كانت مازال قوية بزاف من البحرية الألمانية (""كريغسمارينه"") وكانت تقدر تدمر أي أسطول غزو كيجي من القناة الإنجليزية. واخا داكشي، تمركز عدد صغير من سفن البحرية الملكية حدا طرق الغزو المحتملة بينما كان الأدميرالات خايفين من أنهم يغرقوا بسبب الهجوم الجوي الألماني."
mt: "When the Battle of France began, Germany started planning to invade the island of Britain. Germany launched the secret operation "Operation Sealion". The British Army had lost most of its heavy weapons and supplies when it was evacuated from Dunkirk, so it was very weak. However, the Royal Navy was still stronger than the German Navy ("Kriegsmarine") and could have destroyed any invasion fleet trying to cross the English Channel. Nevertheless, a small number of Royal Navy ships were stationed at the most likely invasion routes while the admirals were afraid of being sunk by the German air force."
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: "خليونا نبداو بتفسير ديال مخطط إيطاليا. إيطاليا كانت دايما هي ""الأخ الأصغر"" ديال ألمانيا واليابان. كان عندها واحد الجيش وبحرية ضعاف واخا يالاه بناو مؤخرًا أربع دلبلطويات جدد قبل ماتبدا الحرب مباشرة. وكانت الأهداف الرئيسية لإيطاليا هي البلدان الأفريقية. وباش تحتل هاذ البلدان فغادي يكون لزاماً عليها أنها تدير منصة لإطلاق القوات، باش تقدر هاد القوات تقطع البحر الأبيض المتوسط وتغزو أفريقيا. على ذاكشي، كان خاصهم يتهناو من القواعد والسفن البريطانيّة في مصر. بخلاف ذلك، السفن الحربيّة الإيطالية مكانش خاصها دير شي حاجة أخرى. دابا لليابان. اليابان كانت بلد جزري (جزيرة)، بحال بريطانيا."
mt: "Let's start with the Italian chart. Italy was always the "younger brother" of Germany and Japan. It had a weak army and navy, but recently acquired four new battleships before the war began. Its main targets were African countries. After occupying these countries, it would be necessary for it to operate a base for launching troops, so that these troops could cross the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. Therefore, it had to contend with British bases and ships in Egypt. Other than that, Italian warships had nothing else to do. Now Japan. Japan was an island nation, like Britain."
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: "انزالات د-داي العسكرية و المعارك الاحقة حررت شمال فرنسا و لكن ماحرراتش الجنوب. كانت كتحكمها ""فيشي"" الفرنسية. هادو فرنسيين اللي دارو السلام مع ألمانيا ف 1940 و خدمو مع المستعمرين عوض ما يضاربو معاهم. ف 15 غشت 1940، دخلو الحلفاء لجنوب فرنسا، الغزو تسمى ""عملية دراغون"". في جوج سيمانات فقط، حرر الأمريكيون والقوات الفرنسية الحرة جنوب فرنسا، وكانوا في طريقهم نحو ألمانيا."
mt: "The French Army and battles liberated northern France but not the south. They were controlled by the "Vichy" French. These Frenchmen who made peace with Germany in 1940 and served with the colonists instead of fighting them. On August 15, 1940, the Allies entered southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragon". In just two weeks, the Americans and the Free French liberated southern France, and were on their way to Germany."
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: "الغواصات و البابورات مصممة باش تدخل تحت الماء و تبقا تما لفترات طويلة. الغواصات اللي تستخدمات فالحرب العالمية الاولي و الثانية كانت بطيئى بزاف و كان عندهم مدى قصير بزاف. في بداية الحرب، سافروا في الغالب على لبحر، ولكن منين بدا الرادار في التطور وأصبح أدق، اضطرت الغواصات تغوص تحت الما باش تتفادى أنها تتكشف. كان يطلق على الغواصات الألمانية ""U-Boats""، وبرع الألمان في الملاحة بغواصاتهم وتشغيلها. على ود نجحوا في تصنيع الغواصات، من بعد الحرب، الألمان مكانوش ثايقين ياخذوا بزاف منها."
mt: "Submarines and destroyers are designed to go underwater and stay there for long periods. The submarines used in World War I and II were slow and had a short range. In the beginning of the war, they mostly sailed on the ocean, but as radar developed and became more accurate, submarines had to go underwater to avoid being detected. The German submarines were called "U-Boats", and the Germans excelled in navigation and operating their submarines. However, they failed to produce submarines in large numbers after the war, and the Germans were not confident in taking them seriously."
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.

src: و ف 17 شتنبر من عام 1939،طاح الدفاع البولندي، وكان الأمل الوحيد هو التراجع ويتعاود التنظيم على طول الجسر الروماني. واخا هكاك، ولات هاد لخطط قديمة بين عشية وضحاها، منين دخل أكثر من 800000 جندي من الجيش الأحمر للاتحاد السوفيتي وكوّنوا الجبهتين البيلاروسية والأوكرانية مورا ما غزاو المناطق الشرقية من بولندا وانتاهكو لمعاهدة ريغا للسلام واتفاقية عدم الاعتداء السوفيتية البولندية والمعاهدات الدولية لوخرين، الثنائية والمتعددة الأطراف.
mt: 17 September 1939, the Polish defense collapsed, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganize along the Roman bridge. However, this plan was not old, and the Red Army's more than 800,000 soldiers entered the eastern regions of Poland and signed the Riga Peace Treaty and the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact and other international treaties.
ref: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.

src: الأمور ما مشاتش مزيان بالنسبة للإيطاليين فشمال إفريقيا من البداية تقريبًا. خلال أسبوع من إعلان الحرب الإيطالية فْ عشرة 10 يونيو 1940 /ألف أو تسعمية أو ربعين، الفرقة حداعش للفرسان البريطانيين ستولات على الحصن كابوزو/ Capuzzo فليبيا. شدو البريطانيين كبير المهندسين دالجيش الإيطالي العاشر، الجنرال لاستوتشي فواحد الكمينٍ غرب ميناء بردية. تقتل ف 28 يونيو القائد العسكري إيتالو بالبو حاكم ليبيا وخليفة موسوليني المتوقع بنيران صديقة فاش كانت الطيارة ديالو هابطة ف طبرق.
mt: Things didn't go well for the Italians in North Africa from the start. Within a week of the Italian declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 7th Armoured Division had taken the fortress of Capuzzo in Libya. The British had captured the Italian 10th Army's chief engineer, General Lastrucci, in a trap west of the port of Bardia. On June 28, the military commander of Libya, Italo Balbo, was killed by friendly fire in a plane crash in Tobruk.
ref: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

src: البوذية التبتية كتعتمد على تعاليم بوذا ، لكن توسعت/انتشرت من خلال مسار المهيانا فالحب أو بْ بزاف ديال التقنيات من اليوجا الهندية. البوذية التبتية بسيطة بزاف من حيث المبدأ. وهي كتتألف من يوغا الكونداليني والتأمل ومسار الحب اللي كيحتضن الجميع. كونداليني يوعا كتفيق طاقة لكونداليني (طاقة التنوير) باستعمال وضعيات نتاع ليوغا وتمارين دتنفس ولمانترا وتصورات. مركز التأمل التبتي هو الإله يوجا. من خلال تصور الآلهة المختلفة ، يتم تنظيف قنوات الطاقة وتنشيط الشاكرات وخلق وعي التنوير.
mt: Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but expanded through the path of Mahayana or a number of techniques from Indian yoga. Tibetan Buddhism is very simple in principle. It consists of Kundalini yoga, meditation and the path of love that includes everyone. Kundalini yoga awakens Kundalini (enlightenment energy) using yoga postures, breathing exercises and mantras and visualizations. The Tibetan meditation center is the god Yuga. Through the visualization of different gods, the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the awareness of enlightenment is created.
ref: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga. In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love. With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations. The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.

src: بدا لبرنامج مع 8:30 دلعشية بالتوقيت لمحلي (15.00 UTC). المغنيين المشهورين كيعرضوا في البلاد كلها البهاجانات أو الأغاني الدينية لرجلين شري شيام. بدا المغني سانجو شارما الأمسية وتبعو جاي شانكار شودهاري. وقدم الشهابان بهوغ بهاجان حتى هو. وكان معاه المغني راجو خاديلوال. وبدا من بعد لاكخا سينغ تيغني البهاجانز. قدموا 108 طبسيل ديال شابان بوغ لبابا شيام (ف الهندوسية، كاين 56 نوع مختلف صالح للماكلة، بحال الحلوى والديسير والفاكية وماكلات وغيرها الي كيوجدوها للإله). قدم لاكها سينغ الشابان بهوغ بهاجان. وكان المغني راجو خانديلوال معاه.
mt: 8:30 pm local time (15.00 UTC). The popular singers were presented in the country all the bhajans or religious songs for two men Shri Shyam. The singer Sanjay Sharma began the evening and was followed by Jay Shankar Choudhary. The shebans presented bhog to the father Shyam (in Hinduism, there are 56 different types of food, such as sweets, desserts, fruits and other foods that are found for the god). Lakha Singh presented the shebans bhog. The singer Raju Khanndilwal was with him.
ref: The program started at 8:30 p.m. local time (15.00 UTC). Famous singers across the country presented bhajans, or devotional songs, to Shri Shyam's feet. Singer Sanju Sharma started the evening, followed by Jai Shankar Choudhary. esented the chhappan bhog bhajan as well. Singer, Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him. Then, Lakkha Singh took the lead in singing the bhajans. 108 plates of Chhappan Bhog (in Hinduism, 56 different edible items, like, sweets, fruits, nuts, dishes etc. which are offered to deity) were served to Baba Shyam. Lakkha Singh presented the chhappan bhog bhajan as well. Singer, Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him.

src: بدا لبرنامج مع 8:30 دلعشية بالتوقيت لمحلي (15.00 UTC). المغنيين المشهورين كيعرضوا في البلاد كلها البهاجانات أو الأغاني الدينية لرجلين شري شيام. بدا المغني سانجو شارما الأمسية وتبعو جاي شانكار شودهاري. وقدم الشهابان بهوغ بهاجان حتى هو. وكان معاه المغني راجو خاديلوال. وبدا من بعد لاكخا سينغ تيغني البهاجانز. قدموا 108 طبسيل ديال شابان بوغ لبابا شيام (ف الهندوسية، كاين 56 نوع مختلف صالح للماكلة، بحال الحلوى والديسير والفاكية وماكلات وغيرها الي كيوجدوها للإله). قدم لاكها سينغ الشابان بهوغ بهاجان. وكان المغني راجو خانديلوال معاه.
mt: 8:30 pm local time (15.00 UTC). The popular singers were presented in the country all the bhajans or religious songs for two men Shri Shyam. The singer Sanjay Sharma began the evening and was followed by Jay Shankar Choudhary. The shebans presented bhog to the father Shyam (in Hinduism, there are 56 different types of food, such as sweets, desserts, fruits and other foods that are found for the god). Lakha Singh presented the shebans bhog. The singer Raju Khanndilwal was with him.

src: "بدات لحتفالات بعرض خاص من المجموعة العالمية سيرك دو سولاي. وتبعوه جوق السمفونية لولاية إسطنبول، وهي فرقة انكشارية، والمغنيين فاتح إرقص و مسلم غورسوس. وطلعو الدراوش الولويين للمسرح من بعد. غنّات المغنّية التركية سيرين أقصو مْعا المغني الإيطالي أليساندرو سافينا و المغني اليوناني هاريس أليكسيو. فاللّخر الفرقة التركية فاير اوف اناتوليا ديال الرقص قدْمات عرض اسمو ""ترُوي""."
mt: "The celebrations began with a special performance by the Cirque du Soleil group. They were followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, an Ottoman band, and the dancers Vatan Erpek and Muslim Gurses. The Turkish dancers of the Turkish group Fire of Anatolia, named "Troy", performed."
ref: "The celebrations started with a special show by the world-renowned group Cirque du Soleil. It was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band, and the singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses. Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage. Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with the Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou. To finish, Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia performed the show ""Troy""."
